meanings.definition: A plural noun referring to coins worth one cent each.
meanings.sent1: I found five shiny pennies on the sidewalk.
meanings.sent2: She saved all her pennies in a piggy bank.
meanings.sent3: The vending machine wouldn't accept my pennies, so I had to use quarters instead.
meanings.sent4: Her thoughts were like scattered pennies, valuable but easily overlooked.
meanings.sent5: The sound of pennies dropping into the jar was music to her ears.

meanings.definition: A plural noun referring to a small sum of money.
meanings.sent1: He only had a few pennies left after buying the candy.
meanings.sent2: She earned pennies for doing chores around the house.
meanings.sent3: I felt like a millionaire with all my pennies jingling in my pocket.
meanings.sent4: His savings were just a few pennies in the grand scheme of things.
meanings.sent5: Every penny counts, so she carefully counted her pennies before paying.

meanings.definition: A plural noun referring to a unit of British currency.
meanings.sent1: In the UK, they use pounds and pennies for their currency.
meanings.sent2: She exchanged her dollars for British pennies at the airport.
meanings.sent3: I accidentally paid with British pennies instead of American coins.
meanings.sent4: The value of British pennies fluctuates with the economy.
meanings.sent5: The shiny British pennies sparkled in the sunlight.
